com.mordoch.chemtools.formulatools

Class Formula

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mordoch.chemtools.formulatools.Formula

  • public class Formula
extends java.lang.Object
    This class acts as a means of representing chemical formulas as Java objects.
    Since:
    0.6.5-alpha
    Version:
    1.5.5
    Author:
    Ariel Mordoch

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Formula()
      Default constructor, creates a Formula representing oxygen in its natural state.
      Formula(java.util.List<java.lang.String> listOfElements, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> listOfSubscripts, double coeff)
      This constructor should be used when creating a Formula object by declaration.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Formula

        public Formula()
        Default constructor, creates a Formula representing oxygen in its natural state.

      • Formula

        public Formula(java.util.List<java.lang.String> listOfElements,
               java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> listOfSubscripts,
               double coeff)
        This constructor should be used when creating a Formula object by declaration. It will call FtHelper.determineBondType(Formula) on itself to set the bond type.
        Parameters:
        listOfElements - a List of bondType string that contains the elements of the formula
        listOfSubscripts - a List of bondType Integer that contains the subscripts of each element
        coeff - the coefficient of the formula

    • Method Detail

      • getElements

        public final java.util.List<java.lang.String> getElements()
        Gets the elements of a formula.
        Returns:
        the elements of a formula (e.g. ["C", "H", "O"])

      • getSubscripts

        public final java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getSubscripts()
        Gets the subscripts of each element in a formula.
        Returns:
        the subscripts of each element in that formula (e.g. [6, 12, 6])

      • getCoefficient

        public final double getCoefficient()
        Gets the coefficient of a given formula.
        Returns:
        the coefficient

      • setElements

        public final void setElements(java.util.List<java.lang.String> listOfElements)
        Sets the elements of a formula.
        Parameters:
        listOfElements - a List of bondType String containing the elements of a formula

      • setSubscripts

        public final void setSubscripts(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> listOfSubscripts)
        Sets the subscripts of a formula.
        Parameters:
        listOfSubscripts - a List of bondType Integer containing the subscripts of a formula

      • setCoefficient

        public final void setCoefficient(double aCoefficient)
        Sets the coefficient of a formula. Coefficients less than 1 are not possible and thus the coefficient is simply set to 1.
        Parameters:
        aCoefficient - the coefficient of the formula

      • getBondType

        public final java.lang.String getBondType()
        Returns the bond type of the formula.
        Returns:
        the bond type of the current instance

      • toString

        public final java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the string representation of the represented formula. For example, this method would return "C6H12O6" for a Formula object that represents glucose.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
